text: The following shall be deposited into the Fund:
historical:
Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 17-219, in par. (2), inserted "The maximum amount of fines deposited into the Fund from this paragraph shall be $275,000 in fiscal year 2009, $750,000 in fiscal year 2010, $1 million in fiscal year 2011, and increased annually, beginning in fiscal year 2012, by 5%."

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 17-197, see notes following § 3-1351.

For Law 17-219, see notes following § 3-1213.01.

Miscellaneous Notes

Short title: Section 3017 of D.C. Law 17-219 provided that subtitle H of title III of the act may be cited as the "Motor Vehicle Theft Prevention Commission Annual Maximum Appropriations Amendment Act of 2008".

DC CODE § 3-1357

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: All grants and revenues received by the Commission, including those received pursuant to § 3-1354(10).

Fines paid for violations of § 31-2413(a). The maximum amount of fines deposited into the Fund from this paragraph shall be $275,000 in fiscal year 2009, $750,000 in fiscal year 2010, $1 million in fiscal year 2011, and increased annually, beginning in fiscal year 2012, by 5%.
All interest earned on the deposits of the Fund.

title.text: District of Columbia Boards and Commissions. (Refs & Annos)
